turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm calling about claim #20231026-447. I submitted it two weeks ago for the damage to my car after that hailstorm, and I haven't heard anything back. Honestly, this is incredibly frustrating!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let me pull up claim #20231026-447 for you. Okay, I see it here. It looks like the claim is currently in the review process. We're waiting on a final estimate from the auto body shop.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: A final estimate? But I already submitted the initial estimate they gave me. Why would you need another one?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Sometimes, the initial estimate is preliminary. A final estimate might include additional damage discovered during the repair process, or updated labor costs. I'll send a request to the shop to expedite that final estimate for you. Is there anything else I can help you with today?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that's helpful. But what happens if the final estimate is significantly higher than the initial one? Will my insurance cover the difference, or will I be stuck paying a huge bill? Thatâ€™s what I am most concerned about!
